name: p-chlorophenol
source: Aldrich Chemical Company; Aldrich Catalog-Handbook of Fine Chemicals; Milwaukee; WI; 1984.
Reason: 1-chlorine substituents significantly increase the melting point due to strong electronegativity which leads to stronger intermolecular dipole-dipole interactions. Each chlorine is estimated to increase the melting point by approximately 10 degrees Celsius, giving a total increase of (10 degrees Celsius x 1 chlorine) = 10 degrees Celsius.
